compound.name: Variable
compound.brief: The variable class for a value and related metadata.
compound.description:
A variable is a result value taken by a sensor or calculated from the results of one or more sensors. It is characterized by a name (what it is a measurement of), a unit of measurement, and a resolution. The names and units of measurements for all variables come from the controlled vocabularies developed for the ODM2 data system. (http://vocabulary.odm2.org/) The resolution is determined by the method used to take the measurement by the sensor. A variable may also be assigned a universally unique identifier (UUID) and a unique variable code. Many sensors are capable of measuring multiple variables at a single time. For example, a Decagon CTD-10 is a sensor. It is able to measure 3 variables: specific conductance, temperature, and water depth. The variable named "specificConductance" has units of microsiemens per centimeter (µS/cm) and a resolution of 1 µS/cm. Each measured variable is explicitly tied to the "parent" sensor that "notifies" the variable when a new value has been measured. Each calculated variable has a parent function returning a float which is the value for that variable.

Variables are expected to be grouped together into VariableArrays.

typeless_funcs.name: Variable
typeless_funcs.brief: Construct a new Variable objectfor a measured variable - that is, one whose values are updated by a sensor.
typeless_funcs.description:
Note

This constructor is NOT inteneded to be used outside of this libraries. It is intended to be used internally with sensors defined in this library.

params.name: parentSense
params.description: The Sensor object supplying values.

params.name: sensorVarNum
params.description: The position in the sensor's value array of this variable's value.

params.name: decimalResolution
params.description: The resolution (in decimal places) of the value.

params.name: varName
params.description: The name of the variable per the ODM2 variable name controlled vocabulary

params.name: varUnit
params.description: The unit of the variable per the ODM2 unit controlled vocabulary

params.name: varCode
params.description: A custom code for the variable. This can be any short text helping to identify the variable in files.

params.name: uuid
params.description: A universally unique identifier for the variable.

typeless_funcs.name: Variable
typeless_funcs.brief: Construct a new Variable objectfor a measured variable - that is, one whose values are updated by a sensor - but do not tie it to a specific sensor.
typeless_funcs.description:
Note

This constructor is NOT inteneded to be used outside of this libraries. It is intended to be used internally with sensors defined in this library.

params.name: sensorVarNum
params.description: The position in the sensor's value array of this variable's value.

params.name: decimalResolution
params.description: The resolution (in decimal places) of the value.

params.name: varName
params.description: The name of the variable per the ODM2 variable name controlled vocabulary

params.name: varUnit
params.description: The unit of the variable per the ODM2 unit controlled vocabulary

params.name: varCode

public_funcs.name: attachSensor
public_funcs.brief: Notify the parent sensor that it has an observing variable.
public_funcs.description:
Note

This should never be called for a calculated variable.

params.name: parentSense
params.description: The Sensor object supplying values.

public_funcs.name: onSensorUpdate
public_funcs.brief: Updates the interally stored data value.
public_funcs.description:
This is the function called by the parent sensor's notifyVariables function

Note

This should never be called for a calculated variable.

params.name: parentSense
params.description: The Sensor object supplying values.

public_funcs.name: checkUUIDFormat
public_funcs.brief: Verify the the UUID is correctly formatted.
public_funcs.description:
Note

This only checks the format of the UUID. It does not in any way indicate that the value of the UUID is correct.
public_funcs.return_value: True if the UUID is correctly formatted.

public_funcs.name: getValue
public_funcs.brief: Get current value of the variable as a float.
public_funcs.return_value: The current value of the variable

params.name: updateValue
params.description: True to ask the parent sensor to measure and return a new value. Default is false.

public_funcs.name: getValueString
public_funcs.brief: Get current value of the variable as a string with the correct decimal resolution.
public_funcs.return_value: The current value of the variable

params.name: updateValue
params.description: True to ask the parent sensor to measure and return a new value. Default is false.

public_funcs.name: formatValueString

params.name: value
params.description: value to format

protected_vars.name: _currentValue
protected_vars.description: When we create the variable, we also want to initialize it with a current value of -9999 (ie, a bad result).
